intro: Lappula tuberculosa, commonly known as the rough lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Lappula tuberculosa is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
